Articles.Content:
I keep seeing signatures saying things like "I survived the 7 days of terror april 2013" or "Never Forget April 2013"

What?

The server the forum was hosted on was compromised, and they were only able to restore the backups from before octoberish 2012. That's one of the reasons you also see so many users with accounts created in April this year.

In april the forums were erased the latest record that survived was from october of 2012

so if you joined after your account was erased(Didn't survive)

We all woke up on an early April morning. We logged onto the fourms, but all we would see was horror. The fourms were down not just down but gone. Hours dragged onto become days. Seven days later the fourms opened up. Hundreds of accounts had been viciously murdered, hundreds more had their post count severely dropped. The entire form had been rolled back to October. During that time I was only a lurker. Posts, fanart, and fourm games all destroyed in those seven days. Today we mourn the loss of those lost in the accident, but we move on build up our post count, repost those post. We shall never be defeated.
No, this is my first account. I never witnessed the tradegy.

I was there whhen it happened. It was, horrible. *Cries.

No, seriously. Lots of us lost our accounts, and hundreds of threads were killed. I still remember opening the forums and seeing 0.16 threads when clicking the "New Posts" button.
They didn't just delete the men, but the women, and the children!

The forums, where destroyed. In April of 2013, thousands lost. It was a fight we all had to survive, we knew. It went on for several days, it was tragic. Some, didn't survive. Others did, but they lost many numbers.

Well, It turns out Squad was experimenting with virtual reality, and plugged in the headset wrong when having KSP loaded. This resulted in Jeb and his rocket spawning in real life, which Jeb was flying and crashed into the servers. This is often regarded as speculation.

My birthday happened.

Just joking, accounts were deleted, KSP forums were down, etc.

Probably some problems with the servers, I don't really remember the cause.

My account was deleted too, but I made it like three days before the happening, and I didn't even post at the time, just lurked, so no problem.
That sounds, terrible....

Yes, it was awful. Many good kerbonauts and their memories were lost those seven days...

Also, thanks for using my signature

I was quite happy to find my account survive the mysterious forum armageddon. I actually only found out about a day or two into the blackout about it, but i was nonetheless spared the worst, besides not knowing if or when the forums would return.

Went a little all out with my sig though... I could probably get around to changing it or adding something else to it just to spice it up.

April 2013 -- a date which will live in infamy -- the Kerbal Space Program Forum was suddenly and deliberately attacked by the Great Space Kraken of the Moon of Jool, Bop

The Kerbal Space Program Forum was at peace with that species and, at the solicitation of The Kraken, was still in conversation with its government and its emperor looking toward the maintenance of peace in Space.

Indeed, one hour after The Kraken had commenced bombing in the Server Room, the Bop ambassador to the Kerbal Space Program forums and his colleague delivered to our Community Manager a formal reply to a recent KSP Forum message. And while this reply stated that it seemed useless to continue the existing diplomatic negotiations, it contained no threat or hint of war or of armed attack.

The Kraken had, therefore, undertaken a surprise offensive extending throughout Space. The facts of April 2013 speak for themselves. The people of the KSP Forums had already formed their opinions and well understand the implications to the very life and safety of our Forums.

As commander in chief of the IT Guys, Harvester had directed that all measures be taken for our defense. But always will our whole Forum remember the character of the onslaught against us.

Yes, it was awful. Many good kerbonauts and their memories were lost those seven days...

Also, thanks for using my signature

Wow.. months of lost posts and hundreds of accounts? Compromised forum?

Blah blah blah security policy. Hourly backups blah blah. Blah blah disaster recovery plan. Blah blah 1996? Blaaaaahh Squad.

I watched it but after i joined the forums by that i was a guest to the forums when it happened

Server crash server erased alot of things that i don't know

Computers sometimes go evil

Oh, and you know that thread "KSPers new and old come say hello"?

That was created after the 7 days of terror as a post disater roll call, more or less, to see who survived, and who didn't.

I was one of the ones lost to the April error.

And everyone seems to forget it was caused by a DDoS.

I wasn't there when it happened.... No, I hadn't even bought KSP. I'm still not sure exactly what happened. Where was the DDoS launched from? No one knows, certainly not me. I wasn't around for the other tragedies either. What was Postcards From Laythe? Who were those influential users banned? But I did see the most recent tragedy. The destruction of a thread. What is this I don't even.

And that scar will never go away.
I bet the Flat Earth Society attacked us, because we believe that the Earth is round, and we make fun of them a lot.

No, this is my first account. I never witnessed the tradegy.

And was I a victim,I lost my postcount. I survived.
I very barely survived. Post count went down from about 130 to 0. I'm still recovering
yeah,we lost a lot of good accounts in those time!
